meanings.sent1: The young doe miscarried her fawn in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The pregnant woman miscarried her baby in the first trimester.
meanings.sent3: The farmer's cow miscarried its calf, much to the surprise of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The project was going smoothly until it miscarried at the last minute.
meanings.sent5: The fragile hope of success miscarried, leaving disappointment in its wake.

meanings.definition: To fail to attain the desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he miscarried in his attempt to reach the mountain peak.
meanings.sent2: The team miscarried in their mission to secure the championship title.
meanings.sent3: The chef's souffle miscarried, resulting in a flat and unappetizing dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her plans for a perfect wedding day miscarried due to unexpected rain.
meanings.sent5: The negotiation miscarried, leading to a breakdown in communication.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: She miscarried by adding salt instead of sugar to the cake batter.
meanings.sent2: The detective miscarried by accusing the wrong suspect of the crime.
meanings.sent3: The student miscarried on the test by misreading the instructions.
meanings.sent4: The pilot miscarried in his landing, causing a bumpy arrival.
meanings.sent5: His attempt to fix the clock miscarried, resulting in it striking the wrong hour.
